definitions.definition: Emotional pain on account of something done or experienced in the past, with a wish that it had been different; a looking back with dissatisfaction or with longing.
The amount of avoidable loss that results from choosing the wrong action.
A person invited to an event who was unable to attend, but notified the organizer of this beforehand; a nonattendee .

main_definition: Emotional pain on account of something done or experienced in the past, with a wish that it had been different; a looking back with dissatisfaction or with longing.
secondary_definitions: ( decision theory ) The amount of avoidable loss that results from choosing the wrong action.
A person invited to an event who was unable to attend, but notified the organizer of this beforehand; a nonattendee .
